text: my name is Petra I work as an
infrastructure delivery technician since
I came to Germany I worked at McDonald's
I worked there as manager assistant
before that I worked in Croatia at
Croatian Telecom it was more sales team
and now this is my first technical
experience at AWS as a technician my
role I am working as an infrastructure
delivery network technician we are
working on spreading the network for all
the future purchases and we are building
the new network
for someone who is thinking about
applying to Amazon what I really liked
here they are not just based exclusively
on which kind of school you have
finished they are going to give you
opportunity if you are willing to learn
the thing is that I was also thinking
about not applying because it's an I.T
industry and like I'm a woman and that's
not really common that women are working
in IT industry but since I came everyone
has been very supportive they are not
really making differences between men
and women and it's making somehow
everything much easier
the most challenging part of my role as
being an intern was that I didn't had
absolutely no technical knowledge before
I came here
and discovering actually so many things
about Network that it's not just like
wires and traveling signal it's so much
more the biggest takeaway is how much I
have learned about networking I'm still
learning I have a big way to go but
until now I managed to like catch up on
Basics and I think it's going to go
great along the way because networking
just the learning part is huge it's very
interesting Whoever has interest for it
and actually the ability to learn and
resources that I have to learn
that's like amazing part of this
